designations.source: A review of the beetles of Great Britain: Ground Beetles (Carabidae)
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the national status of ground beetles using IUCN methodology for assessing threat. It covers all species of Carabidae in Great Britain, identifying those that are rare and/or under threat as well as non-threatened and non-native species.
designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Taxa which are neither threatened nor near threatened.
designations.comments: The species meets the area requirements under criterion B2 for Endangered (AOO <500 km2) and Vulnerable (AOO <2,000 km2). It is declining in EOO (if not also in AOO), with no post-1980 records from the south coast of England west of Lydd (TR01, East Kent). This is a habitat-specialist species occupying relatively small and relatively isolated habitat patches on the bare margins of saline and brackish lagoons, which could expose it to an increased extinction risk. If there was good evidence to show its range was severely fragmented, it would be assessed as Endangered.
